column4: Does anyone know how to kill X server display without restarting my comp? I have an irc server running on this comp and I don't want to kill it...
It locked up, lol
crtl+alt+backspace restarts it, to kill it use sudo /etc/init.d/xorg stop
yeah my mistake its x11-common ;P
it didn't work
stop gdm also then
still locked up
does ps ax | grep X in console list any processes?
it lists tty2 and thats it
you see that number in front of tty2, well issue command "sudo kill -9 number"
it says no such process
I entered the command again and the number is different
if the number in front of tty2 was 1234 you issued sudo kill -9 1234 right?
ohh, interesting, different number
that makes sense, did you issue both "sudo /etc/init.d/x11-common stop" and "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop"
now what? keyboard is still locked up on the screen where the display usually is, and there is a black screen
well reverse the stop with start now on those 2 commands, and hopefully X will come back up with a login prompt
now the numlock is blinking on the screen
Im fresh out of ideas then to be honest, better warn your users reboot iminenet ;P
but dont give up, someone else here is sure to have another idea, maybe Jack_Sparrow  ;)
I tried to remote desktop to my computer, but got an error, lol
